Macros | Functions
INFOC - One-Time Programmable
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides functions for reading and writing the INFOC one-time programmable memory region on Apollo5 devices, supporting secure storage and retrieval of device-specific data.

Key Features

  1. INFOC Access: Read and write operations to INFOC memory region.
  2. Validation: Comprehensive offset and accessibility validation.
  3. Security: Secure access to one-time programmable memory.
  4. Error Handling: Proper error reporting for invalid operations.
  5. Busy Monitoring: Wait for programming completion and busy states.

Functionality

  • Read INFOC words with offset validation
  • Write INFOC words with proper programming sequences
  • Validate INFOC accessibility and power states
  • Handle busy states and programming completion
  • Support for secure INFOC operations

Usage

  1. Validate INFOC accessibility before operations
  2. Read INFOC words using am_hal_infoc_read_word()
  3. Write INFOC words using am_hal_infoc_write_word()
  4. Handle validation errors and busy states

Configuration

  • Offset Validation: Ensure word-aligned access to INFOC
  • Power States: Verify CRYPTO and OTP power states
  • Busy Monitoring: Wait for programming completion
  • Security Checks: Validate INFOC accessibility

Macros

#define AM_HAL_INFOC_WAIT_ON_AIB_ACK_BIT()    while (CRYPTO->AIBFUSEPROGCOMPLETED_b.AIBFUSEPROGCOMPLETED == 0)
 
#define AM_HAL_OTP_WAIT_PTM_NOTBUSY()    while (OTP->PTMSTAT_b.BUSY == OTP_PTMSTAT_BUSY_PTMBUSY)

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_infoc_read_word()

uint32_t am_hal_infoc_read_word ( uint32_t offset,
uint32_t * pVal )

Read INFOC word.

Parameters
offset- word aligned offset in INFOC to be read
pVal- Pointer to word for returned data

This will retrieve the INFOC information

Note
The caller is responsible for powering up OTP before calling this function.

The current power status of OTP can be determined via am_hal_pwrctrl_periph_enabled(AM_HAL_PWRCTRL_PERIPH_OTP, &bEnabled);

OTP is enabled or disabled via: am_hal_pwrctrl_periph_enable(AM_HAL_PWRCTRL_PERIPH_OTP); am_hal_pwrctrl_periph_disable(AM_HAL_PWRCTRL_PERIPH_OTP);

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success

◆ am_hal_infoc_write_word()

uint32_t am_hal_infoc_write_word ( uint32_t offset,
uint32_t value )

Write INFOC word.

Parameters
offset- word aligned offset in INFOC to be read
value- value to be written

This will write a word to the supplied offset in the INFOC

Note
The caller is responsible for powering up OTP before calling this function.

The current power status of OTP can be determined via am_hal_pwrctrl_periph_enabled(AM_HAL_PWRCTRL_PERIPH_OTP, &bEnabled);

OTP is enabled or disabled via: am_hal_pwrctrl_periph_enable(AM_HAL_PWRCTRL_PERIPH_OTP); am_hal_pwrctrl_periph_disable(AM_HAL_PWRCTRL_PERIPH_OTP);

Returns
Returns AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS on success
